They prob will be inducing you earlier(37-38 weeks) because delivering the baby cures you, so when shes ready im sure they will take her out, lol....

I was severe pre eclamptic at 32 weeks and there is a 95% chance of having a perfectly healthy baby at 32 weeks. And he was just fine but died due to a catheter piercing his heart. I would make sure you are seeing someone who is experienced with high risk pregnancies but even if you delivered tomorrow you would have an excellent chance of having a perfectly healthy baby
OMG I am so sorry about your baby musescorner! I cant even put myself in your shoes. Thanks for the valuable information.

I had pre-eclampsia with both my previous pregnancies and they think i will have it with this one as well.  With my son (first) i just had very high blood pressure - blurred and spotty vision - no protein in the urine and was put on bed rest.  He was delivered by C-section at 37 weeks - i had other problems as well, I was born with a dislocated hip and my pelvic area was to small for normal delivery.With my daughter i had high blood pressure and protein in my urine but i think because i was not working full time i had more rest with her.  Did not have the blurred vision ext.  She was born via C-section at 39 weeks.  With both all went well - my son was in a incubator for a day due to fluid on his lungs but fine after that.Take care and take the rest you need

My mom had pre-eclampsia when she was pregnant with me.  However, she was overweight before she got pregnant, so that was a factor in her getting it.  She delivered me via C-section and I was 9 lbs 9.5 oz and perfectly healthy.  =D

question: I was just diagnosed with Pre-Eclampsia last week. My doctor has me on bed rest and is monitoring my BP and weight weekly. I am scared and I don't know a lot about this condition. I don't have protein in my urine, but my BP has been a bit high and I have extreme pitting edema in my feet, ankles, and legs.  My hands, face, thighs, and knees are also really swollen. I am 33 weeks 4 days. My doctor said something about bed rest until the baby can be taken in 4 weeks. Does that mean she plans on inducing labor at about 37-38 weeks? Has anyone else had this and can give me their stories? Thanks.
title: Diagnosed with Pre-Eclampsia... Has anyone ever had this?
